Improvements.Improvement: Avoid raw use of parameterized class
Improvements.Description: Instead of using raw types, parameterized types should be used to increase type safety and readability. In this case, instead of using `DataFetcherFactory` as a raw type, it should be parameterized.

The creation of `DataFetcherFactory` instances for both `QuerydslPredicateExecutor` and `ReactiveQuerydslPredicateExecutor` loops are identical, which is a violation of the DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) principle. This can be extracted to a separate method to avoid code duplication.

Java 8 introduced lambda expressions, which provide a concise way to create instances of single-method classes. Instead of creating new `DataFetcherFactory` instances using anonymous inner classes, you can use lambda expressions.
